intro: Psychotria heterosticta subsp. acuminata, commonly known as the acuminata psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves with acute tips and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often consumed by birds and other wildlife. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
